_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



At Brenntag, we strive for zero accidents and zero incidents worldwide, all day, every day.  As a part of our Core Values and commitment to safety, we, at Brenntag Northeast,LLC are strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This comittment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program.



2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled



Our facilitiy's primary activities encompass wholesale chemical distribution. We have five regulated substances present at our facility. The regulated Program One substances are, Cyclohexylamine, Ethylenediamine, Hydrofluoric Acid, Isopropylamine and Ammonium Hydroxide >20%.



3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



Our facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program.



Safety Information: Brenntag Northeast,LLC maintains a record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards associated with the processes.



Hazard Analysis: Our facility conducts studies to ensure that hazards associated with the processes, are identified and controlled efficiently. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures: For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered process, Brenntag Northeast,LLC maintains written operating procedures.



Training: Brenntag Northeast,LLC has a comprehensive training program in place, to ensure that employees who are operating the processes, are competent in the procedures. Refresher training is provided as required by regulations and more frequently, if needed.



Compliance Audits: Brenntag Northeast,LLC conducts compliance audits to determine whether the pro

visions set out under RMP are being implemented. These audits are carried out at least every three years.



Incident Investigation: Brenntag Northeast,LLC promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated chemicl. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.



Employee Participation: Brenntag Northeast,LLC believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort. Employees are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP rule.



Contractors: On occasion, our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Brenntag Northeast,LLC has a policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractor's work. Contractors are also informed of emergency procedures should an accidental release occur.



4. Five-Year Accident History



Brenntag Northeast,LLC has had an excellent record of preventing accidental relases over the last five years. Due to our prevention procedures, there have been no accidental releases during this period.



5. Emergency Response Plan



Brenntag Northeast,LLC maintains a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies, and the public. The plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place that would require a modified emergency response.

Berks County LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated and verified.



6. Planned Changes t

o Improve Safety



On-going improvements and maintenance to packaging and storage areas, are some of the steps we are taking to improve safety at our facility. These improvements are on-going.
